intro: Pilosella densiflora subsp. pycnomnoa, commonly known as the denseflower pilosella, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters. Its foliage is usually hairy, giving it a distinctive appearance and aiding in moisture retention.
